result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ronny Vernon Smith Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ronny V Smith in court.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court for Ronny V Smith.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: STW 
Case set for Jury Trial.  Defense request an adjournment. For reasons presented to the Court. Case adjourned, Branch 30
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for January 3, 2023 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Ronny Vernon Smith Jr appeared by video.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court for Ronny Vernon Smith Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. Case to tag along with defendant's other case for trial (20CM538)

Defendant Ronny Vernon Smith in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Sarah Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Ronny Vernon Smith appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case in court for a Status Conference. Discussion held. Defendant has a pending matter 20CM538 before the court, which has been adjourned. This case to follow. Case remains calendared in Branch 30.  Status conference scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Status conference scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Ronny Vernon Smith in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Katrina Amy Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for pre-trial conference. Defense requests more time. Case adjourned back to Br 30.  Status conference scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Ronny Vernon Smith in court with attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons as a friend of the court.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 30 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
